ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Geforce 4 MX vs Geforce 4 Ti
ygData.msgSnippet: ... done I was getting great frame rates off of the 4 MX with full clip plane and 4x AA. I personally got the 4 Ti for 299.00 and I am hopeful this video
ygData.messageBody:
>Also, the 4 MX doesnt support DirectX 8.1. I agree, after all is said and
done I was getting great >frame rates off of the 4 MX with full clip plane
and 4x AA. I personally got the 4 Ti for 299.00 >and I am hopeful this video
card will last me at least three years. My last card was a Geforce 2 >MX
with only 32MB of ram so I was really in need of an upgrade.
>
I've got an 2MX with 64mb. I run it with full clip plane. its working fine
for me. Better than the graphics cards I had before. Can't really say much
about my Voodoo3 since it was a defective card.
The waterfall in GD sounds really cool with my Acoustic Edge 5.1. I bought
it as soon as they had beta drivers for XP. It rocks.
luv,
-Su
